com.apriori.concurrent

Class FutureListeners

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.apriori.concurrent.FutureListeners

  • public final class FutureListeners
extends Object
    Factory methods for creating instances of FutureListener.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> FutureListener<T> assemble(Consumer<? super T> onSuccess, Consumer<? super Throwable> onFailure, Runnable onCancel)
      Assembles a listener using all of the specified callbacks.

      Adapts a Consumer to the FutureListener interface.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • forVisitor

        public static <T> FutureListener<T> forVisitor(FutureVisitor<T> visitor)
        Creates a listener that will visit the completed future. When the listener is called from a completed future, that listener uses the specified visitor to visit the completed future.
        Parameters:
        visitor - the visitor
        Returns:
        a listener that uses the visitor when invoked

      • forRunnable

        public static FutureListener<Object> forRunnable(Runnable runnable)
        Creates a listener that will execute the specified task when the future completes.
        Parameters:
        runnable - the task to run when the future completes
        Returns:
        a listener that invokes the specified task

      • forConsumer

        public static <T> FutureListener<T> forConsumer(Consumer<? super ListenableFuture<T>> consumer)
        Adapts a Consumer to the FutureListener interface.
        Parameters:
        consumer - a consumer
        Returns:
        a listener that calls consumer.accept(completedFuture) when invoked

      • assemble

        public static <T> FutureListener<T> assemble(Consumer<? super T> onSuccess,
                                             Consumer<? super Throwable> onFailure,
                                             Runnable onCancel)
        Assembles a listener using all of the specified callbacks. Each callback is invoked depending on the disposition of the completed futures.

        This method uses only functional interfaces, so listeners can easily be constructed using lambdas.

        Parameters:
        onSuccess - invoked when the completed future is successful; the future's result is passed to the consumer
        onFailure - invoked when the completed future has failed; the cause of failure is passed to the consumer
        onCancel - invoked when the completed future is cancelled
        Returns:
        a listener that will call one of the specified callbacks when invoked
